$interpreted: Panicked Demihuman Soldier: We're in trouble, Nigel! The Kingdom of the Sun are coming!
Nigel: So... They've come after all.
Nigel: Yamitsuki, go round up anyone and everyone who's able to fight. This day... the demihumans will fight for their very existence.
Serafin Head: Atlas lies beyond this boundary.
Serafin Head: —Now, Your Highness, it is time for you to give the order.
Angelia: Adelaide...
Adelaide: Yes, Your Highness?
Angelia: ...Do you regret choosing to take my side now?
Adelaide: No path could be clearer than that given me by my noble bloodline. I do not fear the night, so please, feel no guilt for me.
Adelaide: In fact, the most regrettable thing of all is that I might never again steep a pot of Platon tea for you with my own hands...
Angelia: Heheh, you're still as elegant as ever, no matter the circumstances... I should be following your example...
Angelia: ......
Serafin Head: The decisive moment is fleeting, Your Highness. Why do you hesitate?
Angelia: ……………
Serafin Head: Your Highness? If you go back on your word—
Angelia: I'll give the order. But before I throw us headlong into war, I should like to say a prayer for my troops, in accordance with the ancient custom.
Angelia: Let... Let me pray.
Serafin Head: This—
Adelaide: It's just a prayer, Father. Please, retain your noble bearing and give the monarch this one ceremony.
Angelia: Adelaide...
Serafin Head: ...Very well, since the two of you insist.
Serafin Head: Please pray for our forces, Your Highness.
Angelia: ...May the sun shine down on all.
Panicking Soldier: Aaaghh!!!
Reporting Soldier: Lord Serafin! Th-there's a phalanx of monsters advancing from the rear!
Serafin Head: Of all the times and places...
Serafin Head: —Protect the Queen!
Adelaide: ...Father?! What on earth is happening?!
Panicking Soldier: There's more?! How many more are there-aahhh—
Angelia: Gwagh...!
Adelaide: ...Your Highness? Are you all right?! It sounds as though something's not right, we should retreat at once...
Angelia: —When I was still a child...
Angelia: I once met Miss Adelaide at a tea party in the palace.
Adelaide: Your Highness?
Angelia: I offered her a cake with blue icing, only for her to refuse it on the spot, saying how she loathed blue.
Angelia: Later on, I happened to hear how when Lady Serafin passed away—
Angelia: ...She had been wearing a blue dress.
Angelia: I suppose Lord Serafin doesn't know about this, does he?
Angelia: I feared that if word were to spread about Miss Adelaide's rare slip in etiquette, it might cause her trouble... And so I never told anyone about it.
Adelaide: ...Now is not the time for reminiscences, Your Highness.
Angelia: Isn't it? But Miss Adelaide...
Angelia: One day, you suddenly started to adorn yourself with blue flowers.
Angelia: You must have felt very pleased with yourself, no?
Angelia: Wearing those flowers in front of our clueless faces.
Adelaide: Your Highness, what is the meaning of this... Do you harbor suspicions about me? Since when have you...
Angelia: For a long time. But not only you—I've suspected many people. After assuming the throne, I gradually came to understand my uncle.
Angelia: The sect was everywhere, having infiltrated all the kingdom. How could anyone be trusted...
Adelaide: So, all for a few flowers, you—
Angelia: It was because of Elio that I became convinced of your connection with the sect.
Angelia: In his last letter to me was a drawing of that exact blue flower...
Adelaide: I see... Elio... has defiled the pure blood of the Feather Clan. His life should have been snuffed out at birth...
Angelia: ......
Adelaide: I have one question. If you knew all this already, then why... Why have you played along all this time?
Angelia: ...A virtuous lady knows when to remain silent.
Angelia: Before I became Queen, I was a princess of the Carlos royal family.
Angelia: —The firstmost lady in all the Kingdom of the Sun.
Adelaide: It was you...
Adelaide: ...It was you who brought the monsters here...?!
Adelaide: ...How savage of you, Angelia. You and Theodore truly are of the same vile blood...
Serafin Head: No. 2?!
Angelia: ...The Feather Clan... Second Parhelion...
Adelaide: Leave me alone! Even if you are a servant of my grandfather's...
Serafin Head: Second Parhelion... Your eyes have presumably recovered... I implore you to think of my daughter's life, and flee now while you can!
Adelaide: Do not touch me, Serafin...
Angelia: —Fleeing, again? Just like how you've scuttled about in the shadows all this time.
Adelaide: You...!
Angelia: But this flower should have withered long ago. Don't underestimate we humans.
Adelaide: You... You'd dare... dare to slander the Eternal Flower I dedicated to Grandfather Sdorica...!
Adelaide: You're even filthier than Theodore! Abominable! I won't allow the monsters to devour you, because I'll see to it that you die by my very own hands!
Adelaide: In Sdorica's presence residing, I hereby order...
Adelaide: —Kill all the monsters! Have Angelia hunted down!
Serafin Head: Second Parhelion!
Hyde: Give it up. She's not your daughter anymore.
Zola: Heheh, at last... I've been waiting so long for this day to come. Onwards! Kill the Carloses!
: Just as I'd hoped. Nobody... gets out alive...

Model.Text: We're in trouble, Nigel! The Kingdom of the Sun are coming!
So... They've come after all.
Yamitsuki, go round up anyone and everyone who's able to fight. This day... the demihumans will fight for their very existence.
Atlas lies beyond this boundary.
—Now, Your Highness, it is time for you to give the order.
Adelaide...
Yes, Your Highness?
...Do you regret choosing to take my side now?
No path could be clearer than that given me by my noble bloodline. I do not fear the night, so please, feel no guilt for me.
In fact, the most regrettable thing of all is that I might never again steep a pot of Platon tea for you with my own hands...
Heheh, you're still as elegant as ever, no matter the circumstances... I should be following your example...
The decisive moment is fleeting, Your Highness. Why do you hesitate?
Your Highness? If you go back on your word—
I'll give the order. But before I throw us headlong into war, I should like to say a prayer for my troops, in accordance with the ancient custom.
Let... Let me pray.
This—
It's just a prayer, Father. Please, retain your noble bearing and give the monarch this one ceremony.
Adelaide...
...Very well, since the two of you insist.
Please pray for our forces, Your Highness.
...May the sun shine down on all.
Aaaghh!!!
Lord Serafin! Th-there's a phalanx of monsters advancing from the rear!
Of all the times and places...
—Protect the Queen!
...Father?! What on earth is happening?!
There's more?! How many more are there-aahhh—
Gwagh...!
...Your Highness? Are you all right?! It sounds as though something's not right, we should retreat at once...
—When I was still a child...
I once met Miss Adelaide at a tea party in the palace.
Your Highness?
I offered her a cake with blue icing, only for her to refuse it on the spot, saying how she loathed blue.
Later on, I happened to hear how when Lady Serafin passed away—
...She had been wearing a blue dress.
I suppose Lord Serafin doesn't know about this, does he?
I feared that if word were to spread about Miss Adelaide's rare slip in etiquette, it might cause her trouble... And so I never told anyone about it.
...Now is not the time for reminiscences, Your Highness.
Isn't it? But Miss Adelaide...
One day, you suddenly started to adorn yourself with blue flowers.
You must have felt very pleased with yourself, no?
Wearing those flowers in front of our clueless faces.
Your Highness, what is the meaning of this... Do you harbor suspicions about me? Since when have you...
For a long time. But not only you—I've suspected many people. After assuming the throne, I gradually came to understand my uncle.
The sect was everywhere, having infiltrated all the kingdom. How could anyone be trusted...
So, all for a few flowers, you—
It was because of Elio that I became convinced of your connection with the sect.
In his last letter to me was a drawing of that exact blue flower...
I see... Elio... has defiled the pure blood of the Feather Clan. His life should have been snuffed out at birth...
I have one question. If you knew all this already, then why... Why have you played along all this time?
...A virtuous lady knows when to remain silent.
Before I became Queen, I was a princess of the Carlos royal family.
—The firstmost lady in all the Kingdom of the Sun.
It was you...
...It was you who brought the monsters here...?!
...How savage of you, Angelia. You and Theodore truly are of the same vile blood...
...The Feather Clan... Second Parhelion...
Leave me alone! Even if you are a servant of my grandfather's...
Second Parhelion... Your eyes have presumably recovered... I implore you to think of my daughter's life, and flee now while you can!
Do not touch me, Serafin...
—Fleeing, again? Just like how you've scuttled about in the shadows all this time.
You...!
But this flower should have withered long ago. Don't underestimate we humans.
You... You'd dare... dare to slander the Eternal Flower I dedicated to Grandfather Sdorica...!
You're even filthier than Theodore! Abominable! I won't allow the monsters to devour you, because I'll see to it that you die by my very own hands!
In Sdorica's presence residing, I hereby order...
—Kill all the monsters! Have Angelia hunted down!
Second Parhelion!
Give it up. She's not your daughter anymore.
Heheh, at last... I've been waiting so long for this day to come. Onwards! Kill the Carloses!
Just as I'd hoped. Nobody... gets out alive...
